HomePage.title: Hello world!
HomePage.subtitle: Mostly a backend developer — I still try my best to craft clean frontends with Java, Kotlin, and a splash of React magic.
HomePage.aboutCta: Want to know more about my background? Check out the <link>About</link> page or download my CV below.
HomePage.heading: Latest project update

AllProjects.intro: Check out my public github repos!

AboutMe.farming: I grew up working on farms and spent several years in agriculture before moving to Germany in 2019. Those years shaped a lot of my work ethic through the long hours, hands-on problem-solving, and staying calm when things don’t go as planned.
AboutMe.photography: After settling in Germany, alongside working on logisitics, I started freelancing in photography and videography. Running a small one-person business taught me responsibility, working with clients, and building something from scratch.
AboutMe.42: Over time, my interests shifted toward tech. I retrained as a software developer and joined 42 Heilbronn, where I learned C, C++, Python, algorithms, and system programming in a peer-driven learning environment.
AboutMe.schwarz: Most recently, I completed my internship at Schwarz IT, working with Kotlin, Vue.js(TypeScript), Docker, and microservice architectures. It confirmed that software development is exactly where I want to build my career.

Education.title: Education
Education.intro: My education doesn’t follow a straight line. It goes from British secondary school and a practical business qualification to a peer-driven coding school and a backend-focused internship in Germany. This timeline gives some context to how I learned and how I like to work today.
Education.ukSchoolBody: Standard British secondary education up to GCSE's, the UK’s equivalent to a Mittlerer Schulabschluss.
Education.ukSchoolPointOne: Core subjects such as English, Maths, Sciences...
Education.ukSchoolPointThree: Learnt to independently work for myself.
Education.ukSchoolImageAlt: School books and classroom items representing UK secondary education
Education.lewesBody: BTEC Level 3 in Business, a qualification in the UK that is equivalent to A-Levels or a Fachabitur.
Education.lewesPointOne: Coursework-based programme focused on real business.
Education.lewesPointThree: Planned small projects and justified decisions clearly.
Education.lewesImageAlt: College campus scene symbolising further education and business studies
Education.piscineBody: Selective, four-week intensive bootcamp used worldwide to identify self-driven developers This is used to recieve a place in a 42 school.
Education.piscinePointOne: Learned solely through documentation and peers.
Education.piscinePointTwo: Long days coding C, debugging, pressure.
Education.piscinePointThree: Proved the ability to stay focused under stress.
Education.piscineImageAlt: Terminal windows and C code representing the Piscine programming bootcamp
Education.fortyTwoIntroBody: 42 is an internationally recognised programming school backed by leading companies.
Education.fortyTwoIntroPointOne: Learned by building software from scratch.
Education.fortyTwoIntroImageAlt: Stylised 42 logo and code editor representing the 42 school concept
Education.fortyTwoHeilbronnSite: Check out the official 42 Heilbronn website for more details
Education.fortyTwoJourneyTitle: My journey through the 42 core curriculum
Education.fortyTwoJourneyBody: Working through the 42 core curriculum taught me to build reliable software through deep problem understanding.
Education.fortyTwoJourneyPointOne: Built C-based projects involving memory, parsing and processes.
Education.fortyTwoJourneyImageAlt: Terminal windows and project boards showing intensive programming work
Education.internshipBody: I applied my 42 training in a real production environment during my internship at Schwarz IT.
Education.internshipPointOne: Kotlin, TypeScript, REST APIs, Docker, CI/CD.
Education.internshipPointTwo: Contributed to backend modules and Vue.js frontend work.
Education.internshipCtaLabel: Read more about my work experience
Education.internshipImageAlt: Developer workspace with multiple screens showing backend and frontend code
Education.certsBody: I am now continueing to expand my backend skills through structured Spring Boot courses.
Education.certsImageAlt: Laptop and notes representing online courses and programming certificates
Education.certsPdfFallback: Your browser cannot display this PDF inline.
Education.certsPdfFallbackLink: Open the certificate in a new tab.

Work.title: Work Experience
Work.intro: My work experience has moved through public service, agriculture, logistics, freelance creative work and now software development. Each step built skills I still rely on today: responsibility, clear communication, planning and staying calm when things change quickly. This page gives an overview of that journey and how those roles connect to the way I now work as a developer.
Work.lifeguardBody: My first long-term job in the UK, looking after guests in a busy public leisure centre.
Work.lifeguardPointOne: Monitored pool safety and enforced rules to prevent accidents.
Work.lifeguardPointTwo: Responded to incidents and first-aid situations with a clear head.
Work.lifeguardPointThree: Learned to stay focused for long shifts and communicate clearly with the public.
Work.agromilloraBody: Seasonal agricultural work in Australia, combining machinery operation with plant care on a large farm.
Work.agromilloraPointOne: Operated tractors and equipment safely over long days in changing conditions.
Work.agromilloraPointTwo: Looked after plants in the field and in poly tunnels, following strict procedures.
Work.agromilloraPointThree: Built discipline, stamina and a habit of planning ahead to keep work running smoothly.
Work.leaderbrandBody: Continued agricultural work in New Zealand on large-scale lettuce production and logistics.
Work.leaderbrandPointOne: Coordinated the movement of crops from fields to storage, supporting smooth logistics.
Work.leaderbrandPointTwo: Used heavy machinery responsibly across large paddocks.
Work.leaderbrandPointThree: Adapted quickly to weather, schedules and priorities while keeping quality high.
Work.europaparkBody: Warehouse role supporting hotels and restaurants at one of Europe’s largest theme parks.
Work.europaparkPointOne: Handled stock for food and beverages and ensured timely deliveries to internal customers.
Work.europaparkPointTwo: Maintained an organised, safe warehouse environment.
Work.europaparkPointThree: Learned to work efficiently in a fast-paced, service-focused operation.
Work.mlMedienBody: Logistics and warehouse position handling shipments for Deutsche Post in Nuremberg.
Work.mlMedienPointOne: Processed incoming and outgoing shipments while keeping inventory accurate.
Work.mlMedienPointTwo: Helped keep daily operations running reliably under time pressure.
Work.mlMedienPointThree: Took on informal coordination tasks and supported a cooperative team atmosphere.
Work.freelanceVideoBody: Alongside logistics work, I ran a small freelance business producing video content for clients.
Work.freelanceVideoPointOne: Planned, filmed and edited projects from initial brief to final delivery.
Work.freelanceVideoPointTwo: Managed client communication, expectations and deadlines independently.
Work.freelanceVideoPointThree: Learned to scope work, price projects and take full responsibility for the result.
Work.schwarzItBody: Backend-leaning full stack internship on a data-intensive platform used across the Schwarz Group.
Work.schwarzItPointOne: Developed features in Kotlin backends and Vue.js/TypeScript frontends.
Work.schwarzItPointTwo: Designed and consumed OpenAPI-based REST APIs in a Docker and CI/CD environment.
Work.schwarzItPointThree: Improved data flows and refactored backend modules to make the codebase easier to maintain.
Work.schwarzItPointFour: Worked in an agile team, contributing to sprint planning, code reviews and documentation.
